titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams, 1974-1979
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams, 1974-1979

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: (56 35 mm. slides, 56 color 8 x 10 in. prints)

did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams date from concert tours made by Morton Feldman and the University at Buffalo's Creative Associates in 1974, 1977, and 1979.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams, 1974-1979, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection of 56 slides was received as a gift from Jan Williams in 2001. The 8 x 10 color prints were made from the slides in 2001. Scans were made from the color prints by Library staff in January 2002.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p:
Collection contents have been digitized and are available in
University Libraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jan Williams was born in Utica, New York in 1939. He earned his B.M. and M.M. degrees as a percussionist at Manhattan School of Music where he studied with Paul Price. Jan Williams came to Buffalo as a Creative Associate at the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts in 1964. He became a member of the University at Buffalo Music Faculty in 1967 and Co-Director of the Center in 1974. He has been a mainstay of the contemporary music scene, not only in Buffalo, but also internationally, as percussionist, conductor, administrator, and educator.

Composer Morton Feldman (1926-1987) joined the University at Buffalo Music Faculty in 1972. He was the Slee Professor, 1972-1973, Edgar Varèse Professor, 1975-1987, and the Director of the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts, 1976-1980. Feldman also established the June in Buffalo festival in 1975 at the University. Under his leadership the new festival was presented 1975-1978, and again in 1980, with a year off in 1979 when Feldman was on sabbatical.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection of Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams contains 56 slides taken during concert tours made by Feldman and Williams in 1974, 1977, and 1979. The tours were part of the activities of the Creative Associates and the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts at the University at Buffalo, The State University of New York. Locations of the images include Paris, London, Edinburgh, Lisbon, Barcelona, Perugia, Karlsrühe, Dartington and Harrogate, England, Hilversum, Shiraz, Iran, Padua, and Venice. Other musicians in the images include Lejaren Hiller, Eberhard Blum, Martha Herr Hanneman, Nils Vigeland, Dennis Kahle, David Gibson, Julius Eastman, Ralph Jones, Peter Gena, Jan Williams, Benjamin Hudson, Bunita Marcus, and Renée Levine, director of the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by material type into two series:
The description below also applies to the slide collection, except for the physical description.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Morton Feldman Papers, 1950-1999, Mus. Arc. 2.1
defitem.item: Box 15 in this collection contains 46 photographic prints, all of which are available online as the Morton Feldman Photographs, 1939-1987, in UB Libraries Digital Collections.
